text: this is the first video footage to
emerge of jose salvador Alvarenga a
fisherman who says he left the Mexican
coast in December 2012 for a day of
shark fishing 13 months later he was
found 8,000 kilometers away washed
ashore on an isolated at all in the
Marshall Islands reportedly emaciated
and disorientated but alive no details
have yet emerged about how his
fiberglass boat ran into trouble or how
another fisherman who was in the boat
with him died the US ambassador to the
Marshall Islands Thomas M Brewster was
in the room as Jose Salvador was
interviewed by Island authorities he
said that he'd been living in Mexico for
for 15 years or so but that he is in
fact from El Salvador he was able to
walk with some difficulty he said that
he survived on small fish and turtles
and birds while nobody has been able to
confirm the truth of the fisherman story
his family members in the US say they're
stunned at the news I was left
speechless I'm very happy and very
grateful to God and to the people who
rescued my brother I'm infinitely
grateful to those people I don't have
enough words or gestures to thank them
enough for everything they are doing for
him Jose Salvador has been taken to the
islands capital Maduro for a medical
examination he's reported to be keen to
get back to Mexico as soon as possible
Daniel galas BBC news
